issue.title: [CF 303] Combat stat Conditions misleading
issue.body:
Set up a "Condition" on a resto druid to pop an indicator up when Spell Haste is above some percentage.

Casting Regrowth, which activates Nature's Grace takes me above the threshold, but the indicator does not activate.

Messing with the Spell Haste slider reveals that it doesn't look at the Spell Haste percentage, but rather then combat rating.

Comparing this with a petrified pickled egg trinket (procs a haste *rating* buff) the indicator is activated.

This could be resolved by simply stating that the addon tracks combat ratings.

A better solution (imo) would be to track the actual percentage, rather than the combat rating.


> Posted by CurseForge user theondry | Imported from CurseForge issue #303 | Raw

comments.body:
Nature's Grace does not affect your haste rating or percentage in any way. It is is a cast speed increase, not a haste increase, which means that the API will not reflect any changes in your cast speed as a result of its presence/absence.


> Posted by CurseForge user Cybeloras

If it does not affect my haste rating, why does it increase my haste percentage significantly?

The tooltip also says "Spell Haste", not "spell casting speed."

http://www.wowhead.com/spell=61346


> Posted by CurseForge user theondry

Well, knock me over and call me deconstructed. It looks like you're right.
